title: HTML/CSS - Intermediate Level
description: Master intermediate HTML/CSS including flexbox, grid, and responsive design

questions.question: What is CSS Flexbox?
questions.explanation: Flexbox is one-dimensional layout mode that provides flexible containers.

questions.question: What is CSS Grid?
questions.explanation: CSS Grid is two-dimensional layout system (rows and columns).

questions.question: What does media query do in CSS?
options: Responsive design based on screen size
questions.explanation: Media queries apply styles based on device features (screen size, orientation).

questions.question: What is CSS specificity?
questions.explanation: Specificity determines which CSS rule applies when multiple rules match.

questions.question: What is the difference between display: none and visibility: hidden?
options: none removes element, hidden hides but keeps space
questions.explanation: display:none removes element, visibility:hidden hides but keeps space.

questions.question: What is the ::before pseudo-element?
questions.explanation: ::before inserts content before element's content.

questions.question: What is the box-sizing property?
options: Controls how box size is calculated
questions.explanation: box-sizing controls how width/height are calculated (content-box vs border-box).

questions.question: What is CSS animation?
questions.explanation: Animation transitions element from one style to another.

questions.question: What is the difference between absolute and relative positioning?
options: absolute: positioned relative to parent, relative: normal flow
questions.explanation: absolute positions relative to nearest positioned ancestor, relative to own position.

questions.question: What is CSS transform?
questions.explanation: transform modifies element appearance (rotate, scale, translate).

questions.question: What does CSS !important do?
questions.explanation: !important gives rule highest specificity, overriding other rules.

questions.question: What is CSS preprocessor?
questions.explanation: Preprocessors like Sass/Less add variables, nesting, mixins to CSS.

questions.question: What is rem unit in CSS?
questions.explanation: rem is relative to root element's font-size (html tag).

questions.question: What is semantic HTML?
questions.explanation: Semantic HTML uses tags that convey meaning: <article>, <section>, <nav>, etc.

questions.question: What does CSS calc() do?
questions.explanation: calc() performs calculations: width: calc(100% - 20px)

questions.question: What is BEM methodology?
questions.explanation: BEM (Block__Element--Modifier) is CSS naming convention for maintainability.

questions.question: What is CSS custom property (variable)?
questions.explanation: CSS custom properties: --main-color: blue; color: var(--main-color)

questions.question: What does CSS transition do?
questions.explanation: transition smoothly animates property changes over time.

questions.question: What is mobile-first design?
questions.explanation: Mobile-first means designing for mobile devices first, then scaling up.

questions.question: What is CSS containment?
questions.explanation: CSS containment optimizes rendering by isolating parts of page.
